universum.studios.android.ui.controller

Class RefreshController<V extends View & Refreshable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • universum.studios.android.ui.controller.RefreshController<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - Type of the refreshable view.

    public class RefreshController<V extends View & Refreshable>
extends Object
    RefreshController can be used to support refresh feature for views with refreshable data set like ListView or GridView. A view that want to provide refresh feature need to implement required Scrollable interface that specifies simple API needed for this controller to properly handle this feature.

    RefreshController uses RefreshDrawable as refresh indicator that is drawn near the top edge of the refreshable view. To show/hide the indicator a user needs to pull down/up from/to the view's top edge. Refresh callback will be fired after the indicator reaches a specific position that can be specified via setRefreshPosition(float). There are a lot of properties that can be set to customize the refresh behaviour, for example how much can be the refresh indicator pulled (setRefreshDistance(float)) or the refresh indicator's transition (setRefreshIndicatorTransition(int)) determining how is the indicator transitioned to be showed/hided during pull.

    To receive callback about the initiated refresh, a watcher needs to register Refreshable.OnRefreshListener listener of which Refreshable.OnRefreshListener#onRefresh(Refreshable) callback will be fired whenever a user releases the refresh indicator at or after the refresh position. When there is refreshing process finished, setRefreshing(boolean) need to be called upon an instance of this controller class with false to dismiss the refresh indicator. This method can be used also to show (pop) the refresh indicator for example, when the user clicks on a refresh button.

    XML attributes

    RefreshController is meant to be used within views so it also supports set up from AttributeSet via setUpFromAttrs(Context, AttributeSet, int, int) method that should be called from within a constructor of the refreshable view that uses this controller to provide the refresh feature. See RefreshController Attributes.

    XML attributes for refresh indicator

    Refresh indicator drawable can be also styled by referencing the desired style via uiRefreshIndicatorStyle attribute. See RefreshIndicator Attributes. Also, the refresh indicator can be accessed via getRefreshIndicator() method for styling through Java code.
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

    • Constructor Detail

      • RefreshController

        public RefreshController(@NonNull
                         V view)
        Creates a new instance of RefreshHelper to handle refreshing of the specified view.

        Note, that the new RefreshHelper instance will register self as Pullable.OnPullListener into the PullController of the given view, so it will receive pull callbacks necessary to handle refresh feature.

        Parameters:
        view - The view of which refresh to handle by the new RefreshHelper.

    • Method Detail

      • setUpFromAttrs

        public boolean setUpFromAttrs(@NonNull
                              Context context,
                              AttributeSet attrs,
                              @AttrRes
                              int defStyleAttr,
                              @StyleRes
                              int defStyleRes)
        Performs set up of this controller from the given attrs.
        Parameters:
        context - Context used to obtain values for the given attributes.
        attrs - Set of attributes with values to be used to set up this controller.
        defStyleAttr - An attribute which contains a reference to a default style resource, for the view attached to this controller, within a theme of the given context.
        defStyleRes - Resource id of the default style for the view attached to this controller.
        Returns:
        True if some setting of this controller has been changed, false otherwise.

      • setRefreshIndicatorTransition

        public void setRefreshIndicatorTransition(int transition)
        Sets the transition type determining how to transition the refresh indicator when it is being pulled down/up by a user.

        Note, that Refreshable.TRANSITION_COPLANAR transition will for now behave like Refreshable.TRANSITION_ABOVE. This is scheduled to be changed in the feature.

        Parameters:
        transition - The desired indicator's transition. One of TRANSITION_BELOW, TRANSITION_COPLANAR or TRANSITION_ABOVE.
        See Also:
        ui:uiRefreshIndicatorTransition, getRefreshIndicatorTransition()

      • getRefreshIndicatorTransition

        public int getRefreshIndicatorTransition()
        Returns the current transition type of the refresh indicator.

        Default value: Refreshable.TRANSITION_BELOW

        Returns:
        One of TRANSITION_BELOW, TRANSITION_COPLANAR or TRANSITION_ABOVE.
        See Also:
        setRefreshIndicatorTransition(int)

      • setRefreshIndicatorHideDuration

        public void setRefreshIndicatorHideDuration(long duration)
        Sets the duration for the refresh indicator's hide animation.

        The hide animation is played whenever user releases the indicator and its current position is before the getRefreshPosition().

        Parameters:
        duration - The desired duration in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        ui:uiRefreshIndicatorHideDuration, getRefreshIndicatorHideDuration()

        Returns:
        Duration in milliseconds.

      • setRefreshIndicatorArrowScaleDuration

        public void setRefreshIndicatorArrowScaleDuration(long duration)
        Sets the duration for the refresh indicator's arrow scale down animation.

        The arrow's scale down animation is played whenever the refresh process is initiated by releasing of the indicator when mode of the refresh drawable is changed to indeterminate so the arrow needs to be hided.

        Parameters:
        duration - The desired duration in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        ui:uiRefreshIndicatorArrowScaleDuration, getRefreshIndicatorArrowScaleDuration()

      • setRefreshIndicatorOffset

        public void setRefreshIndicatorOffset(@Px
                                      int offset)
        Sets an offset for the originating position of the refresh indicator. This offset determines where should be the indicator positioned when a user starts the drag gesture to pull it down to initiate refresh.

        This can be used for example in case of Refreshable.TRANSITION_ABOVE indicator's transition mode to move the originating position to the bottom if the refreshable view is offset from the top due to its layout margin or due to another view.

        Parameters:
        offset - The desired offset in pixels. Positive value will move the originating position to the bottom, negative value to the top.
        See Also:
        ui:uiRefreshIndicatorOffset, getRefreshIndicatorOffset(), setRefreshIndicatorTransition(int)

      • getRefreshIndicatorOffset

        @Px
public int getRefreshIndicatorOffset()
        Returns the offset of the refresh indicator's originating position.
        Returns:
        Indicator's originating offset in pixels.
        See Also:
        setRefreshIndicatorOffset(int)

      • setRefreshPosition

        public void setRefreshPosition(float position)
        Sets a position determining the boundary for refresh process to be initiated after a user releases the refresh indicator.

        The specified position is checked during the pull against the current position of the pull to resolve whether to initiate refresh or not.

        Parameters:
        position - The desired refresh position from the range [0, 1].
        See Also:
        ui:uiRefreshPosition, getRefreshPosition()

      • getRefreshPosition

        public float getRefreshPosition()
        Returns the current refresh position.
        Returns:
        Position from the range [0, 1].
        See Also:
        setRefreshPosition(float)

      • setRefreshSettlePosition

        public void setRefreshSettlePosition(float settlePosition)
        Sets a position determining the boundary for the refresh indicator to be settled on after a user releases it. This position needs to be smaller or equal than a refresh position specified by setRefreshPosition(float).

        The specified position is used when preparing the settle animation to determine how much needs to be the refresh indicator moved back from its current (released) pull position.

        Parameters:
        settlePosition - The desired refresh settle position from the range [0, refreshPosition].
        See Also:
        ui:uiRefreshSettlePosition, getRefreshSettlePosition()

      • getRefreshSettlePosition

        public float getRefreshSettlePosition()
        Returns the current refresh settle position.
        Returns:
        Position from the range [0, refreshPosition].
        See Also:
        setRefreshSettlePosition(float)

      • setRefreshSettleDuration

        public void setRefreshSettleDuration(int duration)
        Sets the duration for the refresh indicator's settle animation.

        The settle animation is played whenever a user releases the indicator and its current position is after the settle position specified by setRefreshSettlePosition(float).

        Parameters:
        duration - The desired duration in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        ui:uiRefreshSettleDuration, getRefreshSettleDuration()

      • getRefreshSettleDuration

        public long getRefreshSettleDuration()
        Returns the duration for the refresh indicator's settle animation.

        Default value: 75 ms

        Returns:
        Duration in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        setRefreshSettleDuration(int)

      • getRefreshDistance

        public float getRefreshDistance()
        Returns the value of the maximum refresh distance.

        Default value: getPullDistance()

        Returns:
        Maximum refresh distance in pixels or -1 if the refresh distance cannot be right now resolved due to not initialized size of the attached refreshable view yet.

      • setRefreshDistanceFraction

        public void setRefreshDistanceFraction(float fraction)
        Sets the fraction for the maximum refresh distance which determines how much can be the refresh indicator pulled. The specified fraction will be used to compute maximum refresh distance from the size of the refreshable view.
        Parameters:
        fraction - The desired fraction from the range [0, 1f].
        See Also:
        setRefreshDistance(float)

      • getRefreshDistanceFraction

        public float getRefreshDistanceFraction()
        Returns the fraction used to compute maximum refresh distance.

        Default value: 0

        Returns:
        Refresh fraction from the range [0, 1f].

      • setOnRefreshListener

        public void setOnRefreshListener(@Nullable
                                 Refreshable.OnRefreshListener listener)
        Registers a callback to be invoked whenever a user releases the refresh indicator at or after the refresh position specified by setRefreshPosition(float).
        Parameters:
        listener - Listener callback. May be null to clear the current one.

      • dispatchViewAttachedToWindow

        public void dispatchViewAttachedToWindow()
        Called from the view which uses this helper to provide refresh feature to dispatch that this view has been attached to window.

        This should be called whenever View.onAttachedToWindow() is invoked within the view.

      • dispatchViewDetachedFromWindow

        public void dispatchViewDetachedFromWindow()
        Called from the view which uses this helper to provide refresh feature to dispatch that this view has been detached from window.

        This should be called whenever View.onDetachedFromWindow() is invoked within the view.

      • dispatchViewSizeChanged

        public void dispatchViewSizeChanged(int width,
                                    int height)
        Called from the view which uses this helper to provide refresh feature to dispatch that a size of this view has been changed to the new one.

        This should be called whenever View.onSizeChanged(int, int, int, int) is invoked within the view.

        Parameters:
        width - New width of the view.
        height - New height of the view.

      • getRefreshIndicator

        @NonNull
public final RefreshDrawable getRefreshIndicator()
        Returns the drawable which is drawn by this helper within drawRefreshIndicator(Canvas) to indicate running refresh process.

        Use here returned drawable only for customization purposes like to change color or thickness of the progress arc. Any changes related to visibility or position will be changed in the feature by this helper so they will not persist.

        Returns:
        Refresh indicator's drawable.

      • verifyRefreshIndicatorDrawable

        public boolean verifyRefreshIndicatorDrawable(@NonNull
                                              Drawable drawable)
        Called to verify if the given drawable is refresh indicator's drawable of this helper.

        This should be called whenever View.verifyDrawable(Drawable) is invoked within the view.

        Parameters:
        drawable - The drawable to verify.
        Returns:
        True if the verified drawable is refresh indicator's drawable, false otherwise.

      • drawRefreshIndicator

        public void drawRefreshIndicator(@NonNull
                                 Canvas canvas)
        Draws the refresh indicator's drawable on the specified canvas.

        This should be called from within the view which uses this helper to provide refresh feature whenever View.dispatchDraw(Canvas), so the indicator can be properly drawn above all content of the view.

        Parameters:
        canvas - The canvas on which to draw refresh indicator.

      • shouldInterceptTouchEvent

        public boolean shouldInterceptTouchEvent(@NonNull
                                         MotionEvent event)
        Checks whether the attached view that received the specified motion event should intercept the event or not.
        Parameters:
        event - The motion event used to determine if to intercept or not.
        Returns:
        True if the event should be intercepted by the attached view so it should return true from within its ViewGroup.onInterceptTouchEvent(android.view.MotionEvent), false otherwise.

      • processTouchEvent

        public boolean processTouchEvent(@NonNull
                                 MotionEvent event)
        Processes the specified motion event received by the attached view. Based on the data of the event, this controller will perform pull upon the view if appropriate.
        Parameters:
        event - The motion event to be processed.
        Returns:
        True if the event was processed so attached view should return true from within its View.onTouchEvent(android.view.MotionEvent), false otherwise.

      • onPullStarted

        protected void onPullStarted()
        Invoked from processTouchEvent(MotionEvent) whenever there has been observed touch motion that initiated the pull gesture. This is basically motion event with DOWN followed by MOVE action.

      • onApplyPull

        protected void onApplyPull(int pull,
                           float position)
        Invoked whenever pullBy(float) is called with a none zero offset and the new computed pull offset is different from the current one.

        Default implementation offsets the attached view at top/bottom or left/right depending on its orientation.

        Parameters:
        pull - The pull offset to apply to the attached view.
        position - New pull position determined from the new pull and available pull distance.

      • onPullReleased

        protected void onPullReleased(float pull,
                              float position)
        Invoked whenever a user releases the attached view during the pull gesture.

        Default implementation calls collapsePull() but inherited controllers may for example start here animation to collapse the specified pull for better user experience.

        Parameters:
        pull - Current pull value.
        position - Current pull position determined from the current pull and available pull distance.

      • onCollapsePull

        protected void onCollapsePull(float pull,
                              float position)
        Invoked whenever collapsePull() is called and there is currently some pull value to be collapsed.
        Parameters:
        pull - Current pull value to collapse.
        position - Current pull position determined from the current pull and available pull distance.

      • setRefreshing

        public void setRefreshing(boolean refreshing)
        Sets a flag indicating whether the view using this helper is being right now refreshing or not.

        Calling of this method will pop (using scale + fade in animation) the refresh indicator if calling with true or dismisses (using scale + fade out animation) the indicator if calling with false.

        Note, that it is not supported to show the refresh indicator while a user is pulling the refreshable view.

        Parameters:
        refreshing - True to dispatch that refresh process is running so the indicator should be visible, false to dispatch that refresh process has been finished so the indicator should be hided.

      • isRefreshing

        public boolean isRefreshing()
        Returns a flag indicating whether the refresh should be running, so the indicator is currently visible and spinning, or not.

        This method will return true only in case when a user pulls down a refresh indicator and releases it after a refresh position specified by setRefreshPosition(float) or setRefreshing(boolean) has been last time called with true.

        Returns:
        True if refresh is running, false otherwise.

      • setPullMinVelocity

        public void setPullMinVelocity(float velocity)
        Sets the minimum velocity to initiate pull.
        Parameters:
        velocity - The desired velocity value for UiConfig.VELOCITY_UNITS units.
        See Also:
        ui:uiPullMinVelocity, getPullMinVelocity()

      • getPullMinVelocity

        public float getPullMinVelocity()
        Returns the minimum velocity to initiate pull.

        Default value: 0

        Returns:
        Minimum velocity.
        See Also:
        setPullMinVelocity(float)

      • setPullDistance

        public void setPullDistance(float distance)
        Sets the distance which determines how much can be the attached view pulled.
        Parameters:
        distance - The desired value in pixels to determine maximum pull distance.
        See Also:
        ui:uiPullDistance, getPullDistance(), setPullDistanceFraction(float)

      • getPullDistance

        public float getPullDistance()
        Returns the value of the maximum pull distance.

        Default value: see getPullDistanceFraction()

        Returns:
        Maximum pull distance in pixels or -1 if the pull distance cannot be right now resolved due to not initialized size of the attached view yet.
        See Also:
        setPullDistance(float)

      • setPullDistanceFraction

        public void setPullDistanceFraction(float fraction)
        Sets the fraction for the maximum pull distance which determines how much can be the attached view pulled. The specified fraction will be used to compute maximum pull distance from the size of the view.
        Parameters:
        fraction - The desired fraction from the range [0, 1f].
        See Also:
        ui:uiPullDistanceFraction, getPullDistanceFraction(), setPullDistance(float)

      • getPullDistanceFraction

        public float getPullDistanceFraction()
        Returns the fraction used to compute maximum pull distance.

        Default value: 0.25f

        Returns:
        Pull fraction from the range [0, 1f].
        See Also:
        setPullDistanceFraction(float)

      • setPullTransformer

        public void setPullTransformer(@NonNull
                               universum.studios.android.ui.controller.BasePullController.PullTransformer transformer)
        Sets the transformer used to transform computed value for the current pull.
        Parameters:
        transformer - The desired transformer.
        See Also:
        getPullTransformer()

      • getPullTransformer

        @NonNull
public universum.studios.android.ui.controller.BasePullController.PullTransformer getPullTransformer()
        Returns the current pull transformer of this PullController.

        By default, this controller uses transformer implementation with ResistanceInterpolator to transform computed pull offset value based on its current position.

        Returns:
        Pull transformer.
        See Also:
        setPullTransformer(PullTransformer)

      • setPullTransformerInterpolator

        public void setPullTransformerInterpolator(@NonNull
                                           Interpolator interpolator)
        Sets the interpolator for the default BasePullController.PullTransformer of this controller.

        Note, that this can be applied only in case, when there is still default pull transformer used. If there is custom transformer set, that transformer should handle interpolation logic.

        Parameters:
        interpolator - The desired interpolator for the current pull transformer.

      • onExpandPullBy

        protected boolean onExpandPullBy(float offset)
        Invoked from processTouchEvent(MotionEvent) whenever there has been observed touch motion that should expand the current pull. This is basically motion event with MOVE action directed from the pull origin.

        Default implementation updates the current pull via pullBy(float) method with the specified offset and in case of pull overflow invokes onPullOverflow(float, float, float) with the computed overflow and the current pull position.

        Parameters:
        offset - The offset by which to expand the current pull.
        Returns:
        Always true.

      • onPullOverflow

        protected void onPullOverflow(float pull,
                              float overflow,
                              float position)
        Invoked whenever onExpandPullBy(float) is called and the current pull value is already equal to getPullDistance() so the offset of the attached view is not being updated.
        Parameters:
        pull - The current pull value. Equals to getPullDistance().
        overflow - The new overflow value. With the value of pull this is the total distance pulled by a user.
        position - The current pull position determined from the current pull + pull overflow and available pull distance.

      • onCollapsePullBy

        protected boolean onCollapsePullBy(float offset)
        Invoked from processTouchEvent(MotionEvent) whenever there has been observed touch motion that should collapse the current pull. This is basically motion event with MOVE action directed to the pull origin.

        Default implementation updates the current pull via pullBy(float) method with the specified offset and in case of collapsed pull invokes onPullCollapsed().

        Parameters:
        offset - The offset by which to collapse the current pull.
        Returns:
        True if there remained some pull to be collapsed yet, false otherwise.

      • pullBy

        protected final void pullBy(float offset)
        Performs pull by the given offset using PullHelper implementation specific for orientation of the attached view.
        Parameters:
        offset - The offset by which to pull.

      • setViewFrozen

        protected void setViewFrozen(boolean frozen)
        Sets the attached view frozen/un-frozen so it cannot to respond to user touches while the pull is being performed.
        Parameters:
        frozen - True to froze (disable, set un-pressed) the view, false otherwise.

      • collapsePull

        protected final void collapsePull()
        Collapses the current pull if there is any via onCollapsePull(float, float) or notifies that the pull is already collapsed via onPullCollapsed().

      • onPullCollapsed

        protected void onPullCollapsed()
        Invoked whenever handlePullCollapsed() is called. In most cases this will be due to fact that value of the pull has been decreased to 0.
